page.title: 07TRAVELLING TO WORK
page.content: Penicuik is a commuter town. People travel out of it to go to work. They mostly travel into Edinburgh which is 12 miles away. We did a survey of P.6 and P.7 in our school. Out of 108 families only eleven of the fathers worked in Penicuik. Most people who travel go by car. The roads to Edinburgh are not very good although they are used by lots of people. We only have 2 very small bits of dual carriageway and together they are 2m long. It takes about 20 minutes to travel to Edinburgh by car. There are buses owned by Scottish Omnibuses, which run every 30 minutes. It takes 30-45 minutes to travel to Edinburgh by bus. Penicuik used to have a railway line and a station but these were disbanded many years ago.
